xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This module implements the file API EXPath specification available at http://expath.org/spec/file
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: Gabriel Petrovay, Matthias Brantner, Markus Pilman

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Appends a sequence of Base64 items as binary to a file. If the file pointed by $file does not exist, a new file will be created.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to write the content to.
$content The content to be written to the file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0004 If $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:append-binary
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:append-binary($file as xs:string, $content as xs:base64Binary) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Appends a sequence of string items to a file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to write the content to.
$content The content to be written to the file.
$encoding The character encoding to append $content as.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0004 If $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:append-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:append-text($file as xs:string, $content as xs:string, $encoding as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Appends a sequence of string items to a file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to write the content to.
$content The content to be written to the file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0004 If $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:append-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:append-text($file as xs:string, $content as xs:string) as empty-sequence()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Appends a sequence of string items to a file, each followed by a platform-dependent newline character(s).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to write the content to.
$content The content to be written to the file.
$encoding The character encoding to append $content as.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0004 If $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:append-text-lines
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:append-text-lines($file as xs:string, $content as xs:string*, $encoding as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Appends a sequence of string to a file, each followed by a platform-dependent newline character(s), using the UTF-8 character encoding.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to write the content to.
$content The content to be written to the file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0004 If $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:append-text-lines
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:append-text-lines($file as xs:string, $content as xs:string*) as empty-sequence()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the last component from the $path, deleting any trailing directory-separator characters. If $path consists entirely directory-separator characters, the empty string is returned. If $path is the empty string, the string "." is returned, signifying the current directory. No path existence check is made.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path A file path/URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The base name of this file.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:base-name
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function file:base-name($path as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the last component from the $path, deleting any trailing directory-separator characters and the $suffix. If path consists entirely directory-separator characters, the empty string is returned. If path is the empty string, the string "." is returned, signifying the current directory. No path existence check is made. The $suffix can be used for example to eliminate file extensions.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path A file path/URI.
$suffix A suffix which should get deleted from the result.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The base-name of $path with a deleted $suffix.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:base-name
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function file:base-name($path as xs:string, $suffix as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Copies a file or a directory given a source and a destination path/URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $source The path/URI of the file or directory to copy.
$destination The destination path/URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $source path does not exist.
file:FOFL0002 If the computed destination points to a file system item with a different type than the $source.
file:FOFL0003 If $destination does not exist and it's parent directory does not exist either.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:copy
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic %an:sequential function file:copy($source as xs:string, $destination as xs:string) as empty-sequence()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Creates a directory. The operation is will create all the missing parent directories from the given path.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $dir The path/URI denoting the directory to be created.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0002 If the directory cannot be created because of an already existing file.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:create-directory
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:create-directory($dir as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Deletes a file or a directory from the file system. If $path points to a directory the directory will be deleted recursively.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The path/URI of the file or directory to delete.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $path path does not exist.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:delete
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic %an:sequential function file:delete($path as xs:string) as empty-sequence()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function returns the value of the operating system specific directory separator. For example, / on Unix-based systems and \ on Windows systems.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The operating system specific directory separator.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:directory-separator
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function file:directory-separator() as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function is the converse of file:base-name. It returns a string denoting the parent directory of the $path. Any trailing directory-separator characters are not counted as part of the directory name. If path is the empty string or contains no directory-separator string, "." is returned, signifying the current directory. No path existence check is made.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The filename, of which the dirname should be get.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The name of the directory the file is in.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:dir-name
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function file:dir-name($path as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tests if a path/URI is already used in the file system.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The path/URI to test.
$follow-symlinks if true, follows symbolic links.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true if $path points to an existing file system item.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:exists
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:exists($path as xs:string, $follow-symlinks as xs:boolean) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tests if a path/URI is already used in the file system.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The path/URI to test.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true if $path points to an existing file system item; for symbolic links, retuns true if the linked-to item exists.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:exists
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:exists($path as xs:string) as xs:boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: A helper function that performs a trivial (not complete) glob to regex pattern translation.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $pattern The glob pattern.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: A regex pattern corresponding to the glob pattern provided.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:glob-to-regex
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function file:glob-to-regex($pattern as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tests if a path/URI points to a directory. On Unix-based systems, the root and the volume roots are considered directories.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The path/URI to test.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true if $path points to a directory; for symbolic links, returns true if the linked-to item is a directory.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:is-directory
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:is-directory($path as xs:string) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tests if a path/URI points to a file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The path/URI to test.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true if $path points to a file; for symbolic links, returns true if the linked-to item is a file.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:is-file
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:is-file($path as xs:string) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tests if a path/URI points to symbolic link. This works on all Unix-based systems as well as Windows Vista or later.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The path/URI to test.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true if $path points to a symbolic link.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:is-symlink
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:is-symlink($path as xs:string) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Retrieves the timestamp of the last modification of the file system item pointed by the path/URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The file system item to read the last modification timestamp from.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The date and time of the last modification of the item.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $path does not exist.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:last-modified
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:last-modified($path as xs:string) as xs:dateTime external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Lists the file system items in a certain directory. The operation is equivalent to calling: file:list($dir, fn:false()).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $dir The path/URI of the directory to retrieve the children from.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The sequence of names of the direct children.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0003 If $dir does not point to an existing directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:list
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:list($dir as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Lists the file system items in a certain directory. The order of the items in the resulting sequence is not defined. The "." and ".." items are not returned. The returned paths are relative to the provided $path. If $recursive evaluates to fn:true(), the operation will recurse in the subdirectories.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $dir The path/URI to retrieve the children from.
$recursive A boolean flag indicating whether the operation should be performed recursively.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0003 If $dir does not point to an existing directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:list
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:list($path as xs:string, $recursive as xs:boolean) as xs:string*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Lists all files matching the given pattern in a given directory. The order of the items in the result is not defined. The "." and ".." items are not considered for the match. The file paths are relative to the provided $path. The pattern is a glob expression supporting:
* for matching any number of unknown characters
? for matching one unknown character
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The path/URI to retrieve the children from.
$recursive A boolean flag indicating whether the operation should be performed recursively.
$pattern The file name pattern.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: A sequence of file names matching the pattern.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0003 If $dir does not point to an existing directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:list
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:list($path as xs:string, $recursive as xs:boolean, $pattern as xs:string) as xs:string*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Moves a file or directory given a source and a destination paths/URIs.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $source The path/URI of the file to move.
$destination The destination path/URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $source path does not exist.
file:FOFL0002 If $source points to a directory and $destination points to an existing file.
file:FOFL0003 If $destination does not exist and its parent directory does not exist either.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:move
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:move($source as xs:string, $destination as xs:string) as empty-sequence()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The operating system specific path separator.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:path-separator
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function file:path-separator() as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Transforms a URI, an absolute path, or relative path to a native path on the running platform. No path existence check is made.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The uri or path to normalize.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL9999 If an error occurs while trying to obtain the native path.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:path-to-native
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function file:path-to-native($path as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Transforms a file system path into a URI with the file:// scheme. If the path is relative, it is first resolved against the current working directory. No path existence check is made.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The path to transform.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The file URI corresponding to path.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:path-to-uri
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function file:path-to-uri($path as xs:string) as xs:anyURI external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Reads the content of a file and returns a Base64 representation of the content.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The file to read.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The content of the file as Base64.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $source path does not exist.
file:FOFL0004 If $source points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:read-binary
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:read-binary($file as xs:string) as xs:base64Binary external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Reads the content of a file using the specified encoding and returns a string representation of the content.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The file to read.

$encoding The encoding used when reading the file. If compiled with ICU, then Zorba supports any encoding that ICU supports; otherwise Zorba only supports ASCII and UTF-8. The encoding parameter is case insensitive.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The content of the file as string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $source path does not exist.
file:FOFL0004 If $source points to a directory.
file:FOFL0006 If $encoding is not supported.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:read-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:read-text($file as xs:string, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Reads the content of a file and returns a string representation of the content. The operation is equivalent to calling: file:read-text($file, "UTF-8").
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The file to read.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The content of the file as string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $source path does not exist.
file:FOFL0004 If $source points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:read-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:read-text($file as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Reads the content of a file and returns a sequence of strings representing the lines in the content of the file. The operation is equivalent to calling: file:read-text-lines($file, "UTF-8").
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The file to read.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The content of the file as a sequence of strings.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $source path does not exist.
file:FOFL0004 If $source points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:read-text-lines
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:read-text-lines($file as xs:string) as xs:string*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Reads the content of a file using the specified encoding and returns a sequence of strings representing the lines in the content of the file. This implementation considers the LF ( ) character as the line separator. If a resulting line ends with the CR ( ) character, this is trimmed as well. This implementation will uniformly treat LF and CRLF as line separators.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The file to read.

$encoding The encoding used when reading the file. If compiled with ICU, then Zorba supports any encoding that ICU supports; otherwise Zorba only supports ASCII and UTF-8. The encoding parameter is case insensitive.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The content of the file as a sequence of strings.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $source path does not exist.
file:FOFL0004 If $source points to a directory.
file:FOFL0006 If $encoding is not supported.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:read-text-lines
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:read-text-lines($file as xs:string, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Transforms a relative path/URI into an absolute operating system path by resolving it against the current working directory. No path existence check is made.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The path/URI to transform.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:resolve-path
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function file:resolve-path($path as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Retrieves the size of a file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The file get the size.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: An integer representing the size in bytes of the file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $file does not exist.
file:FOFL0004 If the $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:size
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:nondeterministic function file:size($file as xs:string) as xs:integer external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Writes a sequence of Base64 items as binary to a file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to write the content to.
$content The content to be written to the file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0004 If $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:write-binary
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:write-binary($file as xs:string, $content as xs:base64Binary) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Writes a sequence of strings to a file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to write the content to.
$content The content to be written to the file.
$encoding The character encoding to write $content as.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0004 If $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:write-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:write-text($file as xs:string, $content as xs:string, $encoding as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Writes a sequence of strings to a file using the UTF-8 character encoding.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to write the content to.
$content The content to be written to the file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0004 If $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:write-text
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:write-text($file as xs:string, $content as xs:string) as empty-sequence()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Writes a sequence of strings to a file, each followed by a platform-dependent newline character(s).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to write the content to.
$content The content to be written to the file.
$encoding The character encoding to write $content as.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0004 If $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:write-text-lines
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:write-text-lines($file as xs:string, $content as xs:string*, $encoding as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Writes a sequence of strings to a file, each followed by a platform-dependent newline character(s), using the UTF-8 character encoding.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to write the content to.
$content The content to be written to the file.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0004 If $file points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:write-text-lines
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %an:sequential function file:write-text-lines($file as xs:string, $content as xs:string*) as empty-sequence()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Copies a file given a source and a destination path/URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $sourceFile The path/URI of the file to copy.
$destination The destination path/URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $source path does not exist.
file:FOFL0002 If the computed destination points to directory.
file:FOFL0003 If $destination does not exist and it's parent directory does not exist either.
file:FOFL0004 If $sourceFile points to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:copy-file-impl
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private %an:sequential function file:copy-file-impl($sourceFile as xs:string, $destination as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Copies a source directory recursively to a destination path/URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $sourceDir The path/URI of the directory to copy.
$destination The destination path/URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $source path does not exist.
file:FOFL0002 If $destination points to an existing file.
file:FOFL0003 If $destination does not exist and it's parent directory does not exist either.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:copy-directory-impl
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private %an:nondeterministic %an:sequential function file:copy-directory-impl($sourceDir as xs:string, $destination as xs:string) as empty-sequence()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This is an internal function that copies an entire source directory to an destination directory. The caller to this function must make sure that both the source and destination point to existing directories.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $sourceDir The existing source directory.
$destinationDir The existing destination directory.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:copy-directory
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private %an:nondeterministic %an:sequential function file:copy-directory($sourceDir as xs:string, $destinationDir as xs:string) as empty-sequence()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Copies the content of a given directory to an existing destination directory.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $sourceDir The path/URI of the directory to copy the content from.
$destination The destination directory path/URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $source path does not exist.
file:FOFL0003 If $destination directory does not exist.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:copy-directory-content
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private %an:nondeterministic %an:sequential function file:copy-directory-content($sourceDir as xs:string, $destination as xs:string) as empty-sequence()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Deletes a file from the file system.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $file The path/URI of the file to delete.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $file path does not exist.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:delete-file-impl
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private %an:sequential function file:delete-file-impl($file as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Deletes a directory from the file system.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $dir The path/URI of the directory to delete.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: file:FOFL0001 If the $dir path does not exist.
file:FOFL0003 If $dir does not point to a directory.
file:FOFL9999 If any other error occurs.
